maturity_level.description: The organization has defined processes for managing information security.

strengths: The organization has a defined information security policy.
The organization has a defined information security management system.
The organization has defined processes for managing information security.
weaknesses: The organization has not defined roles and responsibilities for information security.
The organization has not defined information security objectives.
The organization has not defined information security metrics.
areas_for_improvement: Define roles and responsibilities for information security.

risks.description: The current state reflects a foundational level of maturity, with areas that require development to progress towards a more defined, managed level.

recommendations.description: Clearly define and communicate the product strategy across the organization.
recommendations.action: Conduct quarterly strategy reviews to ensure alignment and make adjustments as needed.

recommendations.description: Establish repeatable processes for managing information security.
recommendations.action: Develop and document processes for managing information security, including roles and responsibilities, objectives, and metrics.

recommendations.description: Implement technology solutions to support information security management.
recommendations.action: Implement technology solutions to support information security management, such as security information and event management (SIEM) systems.

recommendations.description: Foster a culture of information security awareness and accountability.
recommendations.action: Promote information security awareness and accountability through training, communication, and recognition programs.

risks: Inadequate strategic alignment may lead to conflicting priorities and hinder overall progress.
Resistance to change and a lack of empowerment can stifle innovation and impact team morale.
